title: Here’s Why All Your Projects Are Always Late — and What to Do About It (Rebroadcast)
description: Whether it’s a giant infrastructure plan or a humble kitchen renovation, it’ll inevitably take way too long and cost way too much. That’s because you suffer from “the planning fallacy.” (You also have an “optimism bias” and a bad case of overconfidence.) But don’t worry: we’ve got the solution.
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
